by sharon maher of laughing purple goldfish designs ©2012 2 yarn used abbreviations bendigo woollen mills standard us abbreviations are used 8 ply dk 100% cotton special stitches 200g/484m 7 05oz/529yds adjustable magic_ring amr mc parchment 1 ball 30g used  make a loop of yarn by wrapping in a cc1 blue 1 ball 15g used clockwise direction around two fingers on the left hand cc2 honeydew 1 ball 20g used  pinch the point where the yarn meets between the thumb and forefinger cc3 wild lavender 1 ball 20g used  slide fingers out so that the ring can be used cc4 light teal 1 ball 45g used  place crochet hook into the centre of the ring and pull a loop of the notions working yarn through - this is the starting point for the round 4 mm crochet hook us g  work as the pattern instructs for the remainder of the round - all stitches stitch marker are worked around both the ring and the tail wool needle  when completed the beginning tail can be pulled tight thus closing the 2 x 25 mm 1 in buttons beige ring 2 x 12 mm ½ in buttons blue crab stitch sewing needle and thread  also known as reverse single_crochet  work your round/row of single_crochet in the 30 cm 12 in shirring elastic opposite direction from usual or an elastic hair band  each individual stitch is work exactly as a standard single_crochet but the finished size placement of the next stitch is in the opposite direction from how you would length - 61 cm 24 in usually work circumference - 38 cm 15 in pattern notes gauge gauge  the bag is worked in the round from the for the sample 18 sts and 18 row base up beginning with the mouth measure 10 x 10 cm / 4 x 4 in worked opening in single_crochet us using 4 mm hook and mc  the lips and eyes are then added fishie the plastic bag keeper -
